<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Pro forma net income (loss) reflects only options granted since December
31, 1995. Therefore, the full impact of calculating compensation cost for stock
options under SFAS No. 123 is not reflected in the pro forma net income (loss)
amounts presented above because compensation cost is reflected over the various
options&#146; vesting periods and compensation cost for options granted prior to
January 1, 1997 is not considered.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">13.&#160; COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENT LIABILITIES</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">AIRCRAFT
COMMITMENTS</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December 31, 2002, the Company had future commitments, based on
current terms, for five B767 aircraft to be delivered in 2003. Future payments,
including security deposits, for the additional five B767 aircraft will
approximate $30.8 million and $35.3 million in 2003 and 2004, respectively and
approximately $35.3 million per year for the remainder of the lease term.&#160; In addition to the delivery of the B767
aircraft, the Company will take delivery of a Pratt &amp; Whitney spare
aircraft engine in March 2003. Future commitments including security deposits
for this engine, based on current terms, is approximately $0.6 million</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-25</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-25',FILE='C:\C2\rcheney\8424_11\t_1391586\j8424_10k.htm',USER='rcheney',CD='Apr 15 14:56 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">and $0.7 million in 2003 and 2004 and approximately $0.7 million per
year for the remainder of the lease term.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">LITIGATION
AND CONTINGENCIES</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">From time to time, the Company is subject to legal proceedings arising
in the normal course of its operations. Management does not anticipate that the
disposition of such proceedings would have a material effect upon the Company&#146;s
financial statements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Included in accrued liabilities as of December 31, 2002 and 2001, is
$18.7 million and $12.1 million, respectively, for certain non-passenger
related excise taxes, and related interest, resulting from tax positions taken
during the years ended December 31, 2002 and 2001.&#160; No amounts for potential penalties have been accrued, as
management believes they are neither probable of being asserted and assessed
nor estimable. The related tax returns and tax filings are subject to audit by
the Internal Revenue Service and other taxing authorities.&nbsp;Results of
audit assessments by the taxing authorities could result in penalties, which
could have a material effect on the Company&#146;s financial position, results of
operations and liquidity. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">LOS
ANGELES AIRPORT OPERATING TERMINAL</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On December 1, 1985, the Company entered into an interline agreement
with other airlines, which agreement was amended and restated as of September
1, 1989 for, among other things, the sharing of costs, expenses and certain
liabilities related to the acquisition, construction and renovation of certain
passenger terminal facilities at the Los Angeles International Airport
(&#147;Facilities&#148;). Current tenants and participating members of LAX Two
Corporation (the &#147;Corporation&#148;), a mutual benefit corporation, are jointly and
severally obligated to pay their share of debt service payments related to
Facilities Sublease Revenue Bonds issued to finance the acquisition,
construction and renovation of the Facilities which totaled $111.9 million at
completion. The Corporation leases the Facilities from the Regional Airports
Improvement Corporation under a lease agreement. In addition, the Corporation
is also obligated to make annual payments to the city of Los Angeles for
charges related to its terminal ground rental. All leases of the Corporation
are accounted for as operating leases with related future commitments as of
December 31, 2002 amounting to approximately $207.8 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">GENERAL
GUARANTEES AND INDEMNIFICATIONS</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is the lessee under many real estate leases.&#160; It is common in such commercial lease
transactions for the Company as the lessee to agree to indemnify the lessor and
other related third parties for tort liabilities that arise out of or relate to
the Company&#146;s use or occupancy of the leased premises.&#160; In some cases, this indemnity extends to
related liabilities arising from the negligence of the indemnified parties, but
usually excludes any liabilities caused by their gross negligence or willful
misconduct.&#160; Additionally, the Company
typically indemnifies such parties for any environmental liability that arises
out of or relates to its use of the leased premises. The Company expects that
it would be covered by insurance (subject to deductibles) for most tort
liabilities and related indemnities described above with respect to real estate
that is leases. The Company cannot estimate the potential amount of future
payments under the foregoing indemnities and agreements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">14.&#160; RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company is currently party to two related party transactions, both
approved by the Company&#146;s Audit Committee:&#160;
(1) an Investment Advisory Agreement with Smith Management LLC (&#147;Smith
Management&#148;), effective as of May 1, 2002, pursuant to which Smith Management
provides specified corporate, financial and tax services to the Company, for
which the Company made a payment of $2 million for advisory services previously
rendered by Smith Management and pays $75,000 per month for current
services.&#160; John W. Adams, the Chairman
of the Board of Directors, Chief Executive Officer and President of the
Company, is the President of Smith Management; and (2) a consulting agreement
with Todd G. Cole, a director of the Company since 1994, pursuant to which Mr.
Cole provides executive consulting services</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-26</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-26',FILE='C:\C2\rcheney\8424_11\t_1391586\j8424_10k.htm',USER='rcheney',CD='Apr 15 14:56 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">regarding fleet utilization, scheduling and other operations issues for
a fee of $20,833 per month from May 1, 2002 through October 31, 2002 and a
single payment of $125,800 due January 6, 2003.&#160; This consulting agreement was extended through December 31, 2002
during which Mr. Cole received a fee of $41,666 per month and accrued payments
during the initial term totaling $125,000 on October 31, 2002 and was
terminated on December 31, 2002.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Since May 19, 2000, the Company has invested $3.0 million in
certificates of deposit with Liberty Bank, SSB, of Austin, Texas. Liberty Bank
is indirectly majority owned by John W. Adams and another individual. John W.
Adams is an employee of the Company, Chairman of the Company&#146;s board of
directors and the sole managing member of AIP, LLC, which is the majority
shareholder of the Company. Current directors of the Company include Edward Z.
Safady and Thomas J. Trzanowski, both of whom are also employees and/or
directors of Liberty Bank, SSB.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">15.&#160; CONCENTRATION OF BUSINESS RISK</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s scheduled service operations are primarily focused on
providing air transportation service to, from, or throughout the Hawaiian
Islands. Therefore, the Company&#146;s operations, including its ability to collect
its outstanding receivables, are significantly affected by economic conditions
in the State of Hawaii and by other factors affecting the level of tourism in
Hawaii. In 2002 and 2001, one particular Hawaii-based wholesaler constituted
approximately 15% and 21% of the Company&#146;s total operating revenue,
respectively.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">16.&#160; SEGMENT INFORMATION</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Principally all operations of the Company either originate or end in
the State of Hawaii. The management of such operations is based on a
system-wide approach due to the interdependence of the Company&#146;s route
structure in its various markets. The Company operates as a matrix form of
organization as it has overlapping sets of components for which managers are
held responsible. Managers report to the Company&#146;s chief operating decision-maker
on both the Company&#146;s geographic components and the Company&#146;s product and
service components, resulting in the components based on products and services
constituting one operating segment. As the Company offers only one service
(i.e., air transportation), management has concluded that it has only one
segment. The Company&#146;s principal line of business, the scheduled and chartered
transportation of passengers, constitutes more than 90% of its operating
revenue. The following table delineates scheduled and chartered passenger
revenue of the Company, in thousands:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-27</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-27',FILE='C:\C2\rcheney\8424_11\t_1391586\j8424_10k.htm',USER='rcheney',CD='Apr 15 14:56 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">17.&#160;
SUBSEQUENT EVENTS</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Subsequent to year-end, the Company obtained concessions from its labor
unions, primarily through work rule changes. On February 20, 2003, employees
represented by the IAM agreed to concessions that are expected to save the
Company $3.8 million per year, on March 6, 2003, the Company&#146;s pilots
represented by ALPA agreed to concessions that are expected to save $8.0
million per year, and, on March 11, 2003, the Company&#146;s flight attendants
represented by the AFA agreed to concessions expected to save $3.5 million per
year.&#160; Management expects a portion of
these annual savings to be realized in 2003 and the full-year savings to be
realized in 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">18.&#160; SUPPLEMENTAL FINANCIAL INFORMATION</font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">F-28</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

<font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">
<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='F-28',FILE='C:\C2\rcheney\8424_11\t_1391586\j8424_10k.htm',USER='rcheney',CD='Apr 15 14:56 2003' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
</font>

<p align="center" style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;">&nbsp;</p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;"><a name="Independentauditorsreportonschedule"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">REPORT OF INDEPENDENT AUDITORS</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board of Directors<br>
Hawaiian Holdings, Inc.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We have audited the consolidated financial statements of Hawaiian
Holdings, Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148;) as of December 31, 2002 and 2001, and for each
of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2002, and have issued our
report thereon dated March 31, 2003 (included elsewhere in this Form 10-K).&#160; Our audits also included the financial
statement schedule listed in item 14(a) (Schedule of Valuation and Qualifying
Accounts) of this Form 10-K.&#160; This
schedule is the responsibility of the Company&#146;s management.&#160; Our responsibility is to express an opinion
on the financial statement schedule based on our audit.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In our opinion, the financial statement schedule referred to above,
when considered in relation to the basic financial statements taken as a whole,
presents fairly, in all material respects, the information set forth
therein.&#160; The financial statements do
not include any adjustments to reflect the possible future effects on the
recoverability and classification of assets or the amounts and classification
of liabilities that may result from the outcome of the uncertainty regarding
the Company&#146;s ability to continue as a going concern.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="1" width="25%" noshade color="black" align="left">

</font></div>


<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a) Doubtful accounts written off, net of recoveries</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b) Restructuring charge related to the write-down of DC-9 expendable
parts</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c) Restructuring charge related to the write-down of DC-10 expendable
parts</font></p>

<p style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(d) Includes write-off of DC-9 expendable parts sold</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-align:center;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">S-2</font></p>


<div style="margin:0in 0in .0001pt;text-autospace:none;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">

<hr size="2" width="100%" noshade color="gray" align="left">

</font></div>

</div>
